availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
State of Kentucky Woodford County Sct
November County Court (Nov 3rd) 1862.

R. B. George Sheriff of Woodford County having tendered his resignation which was accepted by the Court on the 6th day of September 1862 it is ordered that John W. Combs be and he is hereby appointed Sheriff of Woodford County handed the next resignation ^for the unexpired term of said George late Sheriff.^ Whereupon he took the several oaths required by the Constitution and laws of the land and together wiith Robert McConnell and D. P. Hites as his sureties executed and acknowledged Bond for the faithful discharge of his duties according to law.

A Copy
Attest Herman Bowman J. C. W C C
By D M Bowman D. C

Woodford Co
Sheriff
Jno. W Combs
vice
R. B. George
Com Issd Nov. 4 1862
